meanings.definition: Serving to make preparations for something
meanings.sent1: The preparatorily checklist ensured everything was ready for the event.
meanings.sent2: She worked preparatorily to set up the stage for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was acting preparatorily, gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The students moved preparatorily, like chess pieces on a board, getting ready for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The chef's preparatorily chopping of vegetables made cooking seem effortless.

meanings.definition: In a preparatory manner or fashion
meanings.sent1: He carefully and preparatorily planned out his study schedule.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the room preparatorily before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: The cat observed the mouse preparatorily, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The clouds moved preparatorily across the sky, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved preparatorily, gracefully warming up before the performance.
